channel.title: How do i add my webclient folder or whatever into my website for webclient?
channel.description: i need help adding the client to my website can anyone help me please ... thanks

item.title: How do i add my webclient folder or whatever into my website for webclient?
item.dc:creator: @FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz
item.description:
@FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz wrote:

joelx617:

i need help adding the client to my website can anyone help me please … thanks

i can help you through teamviewer if youd like i know how to upload webclients to your site. all you really do is upload the client.jar and cache to dropbox and copy and past the html code that the tut gives you to a webpage and your done but id be more then happy to do it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i add my webclient folder or whatever into my website for webclient?

item.title: How do i add my webclient folder or whatever into my website for webclient?
item.dc:creator: @Flight Flight
item.description:
@Flight wrote:

Assuming you’ve correctly jarred and signed your client’s jar, upload the jar directly to the directory you wish to host it. Once that’s done, upload your html file that contains the parameters and applet code required to run the jar.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i add my webclient folder or whatever into my website for webclient?

item.title: How do i add my webclient folder or whatever into my website for webclient?
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

If you can’t upload it to your site and your using a free site (such as forumotion, webs, etc) upload it to DropBox and get the direct link. Replace (in the HTML code) “client.jar” with the direct link to the jar file. Don’t remove the client.class whatever you do…

Read full topic
